alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:58AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Armuchee Creek at Old Dalton Road near Rome affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Armuchee Creek at Old Dalton Road near Rome. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands...fields and pastures begins along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Old Dalton Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Wednesday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.1 feet on 02/24/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this evening at 600 PM EST.
